comment: Great Professor, the only issue you might have is that the lectures can sometimes be a little boring; but learned a lot and he is the reason why I am in the Tax-Side of accounting.
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Cleary is extremely knowledgable in tax, and knows what he's talking about. However, he grades harshly and isn't receptive to helping students/ answering questions. When we went online due to COVID-19, he refused to answer emails and made the final beyond complicated. Also very condescending and acts like you should be a tax professional.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Cleary can drone on in lectures from time to time, but he definitely knows his taxes. Make sure you review any upcoming chapters before you go to his lectures, or you will be left confused. His project rubrics arent always clear, make sure to ask him about whats required for each project. He offers extra credit during review games.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: He knows a lot about tax, but his class can get really boring as he does not interact with the students at all. If he asks the class a question, he will not listen to the class' answers. He grades harshly on assignments, so make sure you triple check before turning them in. I think he's a good professor but overall he was pretty aggravating.

His class was boring, yet he is so knowledgeable. You will learn a lot about individual tax. Take plenty of notes because he allows you to use notes and book on test. His test are really hard. Yet if you do the homework and do well on research paper you be fine. Do attend class the day prior to test he gives extra credit.

Professor Cleary is amazing and very nice. If you have any question, you should ask and he will definitely help you. Even though attendance is not mandatory, but being in class will help you understand the concepts better. Do you best and don't miss any turn-in assignments because those will help your grade a lot.

Really intelligent by all means, but the lectures are a bit boring. Its only cause of his dry sense of humor though. Typical accountant. Its OK though because I would recommend him if youre cool with a non-humorous class. VERY interesting subject too. He uses some good examples. Just need to be a bit more entertaining.
Excellent - Enjoyed the class and learned so much about individual tax

Professor Cleary is amazing. He  is very nice and knowledgeable. The material is challenging.  In order to do well in his class, always read before you come to class. Attendance is not mandatory, but make sure to come to class because professor Cleary explains the concepts much better than the book. I am fortunate to have him as a teacher.

This class is challenging! Tax is not an easy subject, so expect to put work into this class. 3 tests (open book), tax project (don't wait until the last minute or else you're screwed), weekly homework, and a small paper. Stay on top of his class, or else you will have to cram a lot at the end. But overall, you will learn a lot and he is a cool guy
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Cleary is a good professor who is knowledgeable and knows how to break the material down. He's a little cold and won't be your friend, but he will help you if needed. The class is tough and needs to be.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof. Cleary is a tuff professor, his class is pretty dry and boring. He usually just go over the slides.. Tests are pretty hard and he expect you to study by yourself. He usually don't give anything for practice. Its pretty tuff will not recommend if you are working 40 hours and studying at the same time.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Cleary is a good professor, but tax is a tough subject. His lecture style is just talking through powerpoints and it can get old. He is dry and monotone, but he knows his stuff and can be pretty funny. 3 tests, super hard, and some quizzes. Also a huge tax return project, and a short little paper.

Difficult class, but professor Cleary really has a good grasp on the material. Open book, open note tests, but you will still need to study! Usually 20 questions, but they are complex so you will need to understand the material. Fun extra credit opportunities, informative power points. Overall a great professor and I would recommend.

He let the final replace the FIRST exam BUT ONLY BECAUSE of the ice/snow storm. That was the   FIRST TIME he ever implemented such policy. He only allowed students this opportunity who met three conditions: 1) attend all review sessions, 2) take all quizzes, 3) 85% on tax return project. HE MAY OR MAY NOT DO THIS AGAIN.

3 open book/notes test(appendix is big help!),6 quizzes(drops the lowest),tax return project(sectioned up/goes over each during semester-huge help and gives ranges towards the end).Beg. of semester half of class wasn't doing well, and he let our final test replace our first exam grade; went from a F to B :) Definitely a class you need to study for!

This is a tax class, so it is not going to be the most exciting material. Prof. Cleary does a great job at presenting the information in a clear, concise manner and giving great examples, but his voice can be monotone. Pay attention to the bolded red words on the PowerPoints. Tests and quizzes are open book, note, internet. Don't fall asleep!

Hes really nice, and he explains things okay i guess.. but this class is IMPOSSIBLE. I am a straight A student and I am barely pulling a C. His lectures are conceptual, but then you get the tests which are all math based. It is so difficult to apply these tax concepts to math based problems without examples. Awful. If you take him, good luck.
Tests/quizzes open book. Tax return project and a short (like 2 pages max) paper. Knows his stuff but tax is a hard class.

Prof was very helpful and knowledgeable about tax. It is a difficult subject, but the exams and quizzes are open book/notes. Tax project is long but do not wait till the last minute to do it. I would recommend him for this class 100%!

Very difficult class, but tax is a very difficult subject. Prof does his best to clarify a very confusing and changing subject. Open notes/book exams. Gives bonus points by playing a jeopardy review game. I would recommend this professor.

Very smart and serious guy. but has a dry sense of humor. This was one of the most difficult classes Ive taken at KSU. 7 quizes, 3 exams including the final which is cumulative, Tax return (DO NOT WAIT TILL THE LAST MINUTE TO DO), Tax research project on a case study which wasn't too difficult. He lets you use your notes and book on every quiz/test

Super easy for a tax class.  Funny in a very dry way.  As knowledgeable in an ever changing tax code as possible.  I made a B and I skipped a lot and when I did come to class, I was elevated pretty much every time.  I mean, it is tax.

You'll get a kick out of his dry sense of humor because if you ask a stupid question, he'll give you a stare like you're an idiot. Tests can be hard if you don't prepare enough, as well as the tax return; although all the info is in his power-points. Book is not need. Attendance is not mandatory, although its best to go to hear him explain things.

Prof. Cleary is a very good teacher. He knows what he is talking about and he is not afraid to admit that he doesn't know. Hes very honest and the only reason he doesn't get grades back fast is because he is a "CPA", he has other responsibilities than just teching. I recommend him. His test are T/F and a Take Home test (Moderate)

Pros: - knows tax back and forth; - never afraid of saying "I do not know it, need to look it up"; - great sense of humor. Cons: - when you ask a question, look at you like you are an idiot; - EXTREMELY slow grader; - never answers his email. Test are hard; really hard. Make sure you keep up to date with your tax return project; or u r doomed.

I took him a few semester ago, but he was very informative and fair. The subject isn't easy if you're not familiar with income tax. There is one project (2 members) and 4 exams. He was helpful and help his student a lot. I would take him again.
Hard course but good professor and fair

Take this guy for tax! He is a great professor. Slightly difficult, but so is the subject matter. 2 tests and a final; all tests are partially take home. Pretty big tax return project, but just keep up with it and you'll do fine. All in all, I thought he was great. I'd take him again for another class!
Excellent teacher. Knows taxes backwards and forwards

Cleary is awesome! He doesn't discriminate so don't think you can get on his good side and you'll be fine. You still have to work hard for your grade but at least you don't have to worry about making poor grades if you think he doesn't like you.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!! Informative and Fair. Tests are not too bad. Helps on the Tax projects. Would definately take again!
Good professor, really want to help students to do well in his class. His tests are not difficult if you'll study.
Great teacher. Definitely Recommended for Tax.!!

GREAT TEACHER!!  He explains everything very well and only tests you on what he covers in class.  He plays a review game before every test, tells you specific sections and page #'s in the book to study, and gives bonus points.  If your interested in working with tax, I definately recomend Prof. Cleary!

HORRIBLE. He was awful at explaining things, tests were semi-tough, but was rude (always complaining about our grades... hello, if the test average was a 70-something, that does not just reflect on the student's part). Did not throw out bad questions, but suggested that we change our major out of the business school. Take anyone else.

Very hard class but this is due to the material.  Professor gives extra credit and lets you redo test for extra points.  You also are able to use the book on tests.  I did bad on the tests and still made an A.  Great guy.

Good teacher. Class attendance and reading the book is very important, but he gives easy m/c quizzes and tests. Quizzes can be used to get a lot of extra credit. Some concepts are taught unclearly, but he will always go over them again if asked. Very helpful and nice; wants students to succeed.

Good teacher. Does a decent job at explaining concepts. Devotes at least half a class period before test-day to review; tests are ~80% departmental, mostly concepts. Will throw out "bad" questions - ones missed by majority. Easy, multiple-choice quiz after every chapter. Point-system; extra credit!
